title: Conclusion at the ICWSM 2011

author: James G. Shanahan, Church and Duncan Group, Inc.

segmentation: OK, so basically we want to wrap up by having a town Hall meeting and this gives you give us a chance to talk with you and get your feedback on the conference and also tell you about the future plans for the conference as well.
So the.
We started this week.
By saying hey, what a year it has been in terms of global developments, both politically socially, technology from a technology perspective and so on.
But like sorry.
So.
We review the year globally, but I must say what a week has been here.
It's been great to see such energy and such vibrant talks and to learn so much from you.
Also, I really thank you very much.
I think that.
ICW Sam has really come of age in the last couple of years and I really appreciate your support for this year so.
I'd like to tell you about my top 10 for this week.
And then I'd like to tell you about where I see WSM will be taking place in 2012.
And then we're going to have an open mic, and hopefully in 30 minutes time we can have a closing reception.
So you're in control of that.
So I'm going to take a few minutes.
Alright.
Alright.
So it's my personal top 10, so it's a little biased movie.
So.
Basically, this year we tried a number of different things and of course we welcome your feedback on this.
So first thing is that we had a two tier review system.
We had a PC members, an senior PC members and that seemed to work well from our perspective.
Hopefully you felt it was fair and good.
Also, we also had a double blind review system.
And.
Right now you're all carrying out a survey which is going to help us crowd source the best papers, so I'm sorry it's best pacer papers should be.
Typo.
Another thing that we did this year is that we had student awards and I think that was a huge success.
And let me tell you, this is only a start.
Next year we hope to double the amounts of this student student student awards because it's very important to support the younger generation and so.
Enough about that?
OK, so then we're having a town Hall meeting, and I think it's very important that we have these types of forms for us to talk to each other.
And we're also soliciting calls for proposals for future venues of ICW stems.
And so we're getting more rigorous about how we do things, I guess.
One more thing.
Tomorrow we have three workshops lined up.
Hopefully you'll stick around and participate.
We certainly look forward to these workshops.
So we're really were in top Ten mode now I guess.
So here are some of the highlights from the organize.
King committee
The poster sessions were, I think, really great.
I love the energy.
And the buzz, and to see a poster with 10 people around it was amazing.
I must say what a fantastic audience you've been this week, and I think that this comes across in many different.
Ways so, for example, there was a lot of tweeting going on, which was awesome and lots of note taking their wiki notes for example here.
Somebody put together Google Doc on Duncan's talk for this afternoon.
It was amazing collaboration.
We had Google Plus stream live.
Thanks to Natalie.
Facebook.
We had a.
Your photo place.
And I should say thank you very much to the social media folks.
Here's a short list of some of the bigger contributors for the week, so thank you.
Let's let's put our hands.
Intention.
So I want to stop here for a moment while we tally the count for best papers.
So what I want you to do is first of all vote.
That's possible, and Secondly, I want you to turn to your neighbor and discuss what you really liked about this week or maybe hated about this week.
And then I'm going to call upon you randomly, and maybe you can share your thoughts with us.
So we'll stop for two minutes.
And please vote.
